title: Lily page header alignment: align pond metadata to content column while keeping back button offset

requirements.summary: Adjust LilyPage header layout so pond avatar/metadata aligns with the main content column while the back button remains offset to the left without overlap.
acceptanceCriteria: On the Lily page, the left edge of the pond avatar metadata block (avatar + metadata text) visually aligns with the left edge of the lily title, description, image block, link block, and the action buttons row (i.e., they share one consistent content column).
The back button remains positioned to the left of (in front of) the pond avatar metadata block, and is the only element that does not share the main content columnâ€™s left alignment.
The back button remains clickable and does not overlap/interfere with the avatar/metadata or title on common viewport widths (mobile and desktop).
Changes are scoped to the Lily page only; do not introduce or move any back button UI to other pages (e.g., the Frog profile page).

file_operations.description: Rework the header wrapper and positioning so the pond avatar + metadata render in the normal document flow at the same left edge as the title/body content, while the back button is removed from the flow and positioned offset to the left (e.g., via a relative header container with an absolutely-positioned back button and overflow-visible on the surrounding wrapper). Ensure the back button has a safe z-index and hit-area, and that spacing/offsets adapt on mobile/desktop so it remains clickable without overlapping the avatar/metadata or the title. Keep changes scoped to this page and avoid altering lily content rendering logic.
